intro: Euryops tenuilobus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed bushveld daisies, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. Euryops tenuilobus is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
